decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to assemble and protect the combo of Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck focuses on disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also utilizing cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Fear of Missing Out for additional advantage. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Overlord of the Balemurk and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship to close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to build a fast-paced aggressive strategy using Spirit creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Mausoleum Wanderer, Supreme Phantom, and Spell Queller, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like No More Lies and Skyclave Apparition to control the board and protect its creatures. With a mix of evasion, tempo plays, and resilience, this Spirit Aggro deck is designed to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Heartless Act and Fatal Push, and controlling creatures like Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also utilizes powerful enchantments like Unholy Annex and Ritual Chamber to further control the game. The goal is to maintain a strong board presence while keeping your opponent off balance, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and careful decision-making.

The main goal of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Archon of Emeria, Aven Interrupter, and Elite Spellbinder while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to curve out smoothly with cards like Collected Company and Elvish Mystic, allowing it to maintain a strong board presence and close out games quickly. Additionally, cards like Werefox Bodyguard and Virtue of Loyalty provide the deck with additional ways to protect its key threats and maintain board control.

The deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects and synergies to put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Bloodtithe Harvester with cards like Witch's Oven and Deadly Dispute, the deck can deal damage to the opponent and generate value. Mayhem Devil and other cards like Claim the Firstborn and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This aggro deck focuses on playing powerful spirit creatures quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent. Utilizing cards like Mausoleum Wanderer, Spell Queller, and Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage rapidly. The inclusion of cards like No More Lies and Wedding Announcement provide additional utility and protection for your creatures. With a mix of powerful spirits and support spells, this deck is designed to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive, making it a formidable opponent in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to maintain control over the board through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and creature threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while using removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act to deal with threats. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Blade of the Oni to apply pressure and close out the game. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on early mana ramp with Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic to quickly play powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Skyclave Apparition. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts opponents' spells, while Elite Spellbinder and Aven Interrupter provide additional disruption and control. Collected Company helps dig for more threats while Branchloft Pathway provides flexible mana fixing. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive creature-based strategy, backed up by disruption and control elements to maintain tempo and pressure.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that allow the player to control the game through removal, disruption, and versatile threats. By playing a variety of multicolored spells, the deck takes advantage of Niv-Mizzet Reborn's ability to generate card advantage and provide a strong board presence. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allows for extra value by flickering permanents like Fabled Passage or Leyline Binding. With a mix of ramp, removal, and powerful creatures, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the flow of the game until it can secure a win.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board state while slowly controlling the pace of the game. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Graveyard Trespasser, the player can pick apart their opponent's resources. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, it has ways to generate card advantage and continuous pressure through cards like Bloodletter of Aclazotz and Unstoppable Slasher. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and ultimately grind them out of the game.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while efficiently removing threats with Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck aims to maintain card advantage with Castle Locthwain and Bloodletter of Aclazotz, while applying pressure with Unstoppable Slasher and Graveyard Trespasser. The inclusion of Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Mutavault allows for flexibility in mana production and creature activation. Field of Ruin helps deal with problematic lands, and Sheoldred's Edict provides additional removal options. The deck's win conditions include Invoke Despair and Reckoner Bankbuster.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. By efficiently utilizing low-cost removal like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize alongside powerful threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure and disrupt opponents' game plans. By incorporating versatile lands like Mutavault and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the deck can adapt to various situations and maintain a relentless assault. The inclusion of Unholy Annex and Bloodtithe Harvester also provides additional utility and resilience in longer games.
